data.title: Exor CEO says Juventus is not up for sale
data.meta_description: Exor CEO John Elkann said Thursday that they have not received any approach from funds over a possible sale of Serie A club Juventus.
data.text: Exor CEO John Elkann said yesterday that the investment firm has "not received any approach from funds over a possible sale" of Serie A club Juventus and that the firm is not interested in selling, according to Giulio Piovaccari of REUTERS. Asked by reporters during a news conference ahead of Exor's capital markets day whether any funds, including Arab or American, had "approached" the firm -- controlled by Italy's Agnelli family -- over a possible transaction, Elkann said "no." Elkann: "Nor have we approached funds, it's not a scenario we're interested in." He added that Exor was "not considering delisting Juventus." The Turin-based soccer club last month approved a capital increase of up to $218M. Exor, which owns a 64% stake in Juventus, had "made an initial payment" of about $87M to "support the club pending the capital increase" (REUTERS, 11/30).
